repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Mining Sector Capacity
            Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Mining Sector Capacity Building
            Project had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            Lessons learned: Government commitment and buy-in from an
            early stage are essential for regulatory/legal/institutional
            reform and subsequent sustainability. The Mining Sector
            Capacity Building Project (PRISM) received counterpart funds
            in a timely manner, especially because of a close working
            relationship maintained between the Project Implementation
            Unit (PIU) and the Ministry of Finance. Institutional
            development impact can only be achieved with strong
            Government ownership. Autonomous institutions should be set
            up, if possible, in a transparent manner, and should follow
            clear and specific procedures. Adequate supervision and a
            strong relationship between the task team and the Project
            management team are essential to achieve the realization of
            project outcomes and full disbursement. Stability of task
            team engaged in project supervision is very important to
            maintain a working relationship with the PIU/Government
            actors. The PRISM was implemented under an independent PIU,
            rather than through the MMI, even though this arrangement
            was initially considered. The PRISM team worked closely with
            its contracted consultants, assured timely delivery of
            contracts and was also heavily involved in negotiations of
            larger contracts.

5084459.trustfund:
TF025638-PHRD-MINING SECTOR DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF039850-CONGO DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC - TA
            TO MINISTRY OF MINES.

repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Mining Sector Capacity
            Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Mining Sector Capacity Building
            Project will strengthen the Government's capacity to
            facilitate and regulate mining activities, and increase
            private investment in the sector, which will provide a sound
            basis for exploitation, over the long term, of the
            country's natural resources potential. The main
            components provide for: 1) Capacity building, which will
            restructure and strengthen the Ministry of Mines and
            Industry (MMI) towards mining law enforcement. This includes
            organization and staffing of key administrative units with
            new procedures, staff training, supply of equipment, and
            rehabilitation of facilities. Additionally, proper computer
            based cadastre and mine reporting systems will be
            established, together with explicit criteria and
            non-discretionary procedures for granting/foreclosing of
            mining rights; 2) Geologic infrastructure, which includes
            the preparation of digital geological maps, and, development
            of a data base for compilation/update of geological
            information. Supporting the geological mapping, a geophysic
            airborne survey will be implemented. Supervision will follow
            the integration of this component, with a final processing
            and printing of the digital mapping; 3) Environmental
            management system, to include capacity building at MMI, for
            monitoring and enforcement of environmental regulations.
            Studies will assess and monitor social, cultural, and
            economic impacts on local communities.
